Description: Glazed composition shabti of the God's Father and God's Servant of the Lady of the Sycamore, Wahibramakhet, born of Bastetirdis, with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a plaited beard, crossed hands in relief holding a hoe, an adze and the string of the incised seed-basket which hangs over the shoulder, the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of incised hieroglyphs; there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Curator's comments: The collection contains a second shabti of the same man (EA 34126).
